summary: Completed frontend testing for three new pediatric medical calculator features: 1) DKA approach with SMC Guideline toggle, 2) IEM Emergencies approach, 3) Acetaminophen Rumack-Matthew Nomogram with new SVG. All 6 test cases PASSED.
passed_tests: TEST 1: DKA Approach - Saudi Booklet / SMC Guideline toggle switch present with data-testid='dka-guideline-switch' - PASSED
TEST 2: DKA Approach - SMC Guideline content displays correctly (Introduction, Diagnosis, Fluids, Insulin sections) - PASSED
TEST 3: IEM Emergencies Approach - Page loads with 'Inborn Error of Metabolism Emergencies' title - PASSED
TEST 4: IEM Emergencies Approach - Disease Crisis Quick Reference table shows all 9 diseases (Propionic Acidemia, MMA, MSUD, VLCAD, CPT1, GSD1, Mitochondrial, PKU, Hunter) - PASSED
TEST 5: Acetaminophen Approach - Rumack-Matthew Nomogram section loads correctly - PASSED
TEST 6: Acetaminophen Approach - Nomogram SVG image loads from /images/rumack_matthew_nomogram_new.svg (450x550 dimensions) - PASSED
critical_code_review_comments: DkaApproach.jsx: Toggle switch correctly implemented with useState for useSMCGuideline state
DkaApproach.jsx: Saudi Booklet shows Recognition & Diagnosis, 1st Hour Management, Fluid Management, Insulin, Potassium, Dextrose, Cerebral Edema, DKA Resolution sections

DkaApproach.jsx: SMC Guideline shows Introduction, Diagnosis, Initial Investigations, Monitoring, Fluids, Potassium, Insulin, Bicarbonate, Cerebral Edema, Troubleshooting sections with Kingdom of Bahrain reference
IEMEmergencyApproach.jsx: Disease Crisis Quick Reference table correctly displays 9 diseases with Crisis, Blood Gas, HCO3, CPK, Lactate, D10%, Carnitine, Ammonia columns
IEMEmergencyApproach.jsx: Emergency Regimen Principles section shows Metabolic Stress Triggers (Infection, Fasting, Dietary disturbance, Exercise, Constipation, Vomiting/diarrhea)
AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: Rumack-Matthew Nomogram SVG correctly imported from /images/rumack_matthew_nomogram_new.svg
AcetaminophenApproach.jsx: Nomogram includes unit toggle (Âµmol/L SI vs mcg/mL), hours post-ingestion input, serum level input, and patient data point overlay
ApproachesPage.jsx: IEM Emergencies correctly added to approachTabs with id='iem' and appropriate keywords
context_for_next_testing_agent: Three new features verified: 1) DKA approach toggle between Saudi Booklet (default) and SMC Guideline - toggle switch has data-testid='dka-guideline-switch', 2) IEM Emergencies approach accessible via dropdown with id='iem' - shows Disease Crisis Quick Reference table with 9 metabolic diseases, 3) Acetaminophen approach uses new SVG nomogram from /images/rumack_matthew_nomogram_new.svg with dimensions 450x550. Navigation path: Login -> I Agree -> ER/Pediatric Ward -> Approaches -> Select from dropdown. All features working correctly.
